alert.note: Alert for Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area; Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision Coastal Area; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 6:00AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...POTENTIAL MARINE LAYER FOLLOWED BY WARMER THAN NORMAL TEMPERATURES HEADING INTO NEXT WEEK... Warmer than normal temperatures are expected by late this weekend as temperatures rise by a couple degrees each day. The warmest days are expected to be early next week with highs in the mid 70s and continued dry conditions. Marine layer clouds over the Gulf of Alaska may move into the outer coast periodically over the next several days. Typically these clouds move in during the overnight hours and back off during the day. Timing of the clouds moving in and out will affect how much warming is able to occur. For details on specific locations important to you, see the point and click forecast located at weather.gov/juneau. For important heat related safety information, visit weather.gov/safety/heat and weather.gov/safety/coldwater.
